author: Slidebean
description:
Big Tech doesn’t want to count its own pollution.

The Greenhouse Gas Protocol, the global rulebook for corporate carbon reporting is under attack.

Why? Because companies like Google, Amazon, and Microsoft are lobbying to change how emissions are counted.

Right now, they offset dirty nighttime power by buying “clean energy credits” from the daytime.
In other words: burn coal at midnight, brag about solar at noon.

New rules would force hourly tracking of energy use, no more creative accounting for data centers running 24/7.

👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: Google, Amazon, and Microsoft don’t want you to see their real emissions

author: Slidebean
description:
Space junk just hit a satellite and made more space junk.

A Chinese satellite was struck by space debris this week, creating even more debris now orbiting Earth.

It’s the same problem on repeat, every collision makes the next one more likely.

Humans are messy. We’ve polluted land, oceans and now orbit.

👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: A Chinese satellite collision highlights space’s growing trash problem

author: Slidebean
description:
MoviePass is back and this time, it wants you to gamble on movies.

Yep, the same company that offered unlimited movies for $10 is back with a new idea: Mogul, a fantasy league for film buffs.

You pick upcoming movies, predict box office performance, and win real prizes cash, tickets, gift cards.

It’s Fantasy Football, but for cinephiles.

Only catch? It runs on blockchain, which means the game could turn into just another token trading casino.

👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: MoviePass returns with a fantasy league for the box office
